title: 104_hr2108
content:
The Act titled "District of Columbia Convention Center and Sports Arena Authorization Act of 1995" allows the Washington Convention Center Authority to use revenues for convention center activities and permits borrowing funds for preconstruction activities related to the Gallery Place sports arena. No appropriation is needed for arena preconstruction activities, and certain District revenues can be pledged as security for borrowing. Additionally, the Act includes a waiver of congressional review. TITLE III--WAIVER OF CONGRESSIONAL REVIEW

Sec. 301. Waiver of Congressional review of Arena Tax Payment and Use Amendment Act of 1995. The text chunk discusses the exemption of certain revenues of the District of Columbia from requiring appropriation for specific activities related to the Washington Convention Center. These activities include operating and maintaining the current center and preconstruction work for a new convention center. SEC. 201 permits designated authority to borrow funds for preconstruction activities for Gallery Place Sports Arena. The designated authority is allowed to borrow funds through revenue bonds, notes, or other obligations secured by revenues to finance arena preconstruction activities if granted authority by the District of Columbia government. The borrowing must be secured by revenues from the sports arena tax imposed by D.C. Law 10-128. The designated authority can borrow funds through revenue bonds or other obligations secured by revenues to finance arena preconstruction activities. Any debt created shall not be considered general obligation debt of the District of Columbia or constitute the lending of public credit for private purposes. The term "designated authority" refers to the Redevelopment Land Agency or another District of Columbia government agency designated by the Mayor for arena preconstruction activities, excluding any involvement of the District's full faith and credit. SEC. 202 permits certain district revenues to be used as security for borrowing. The District of Columbia can pledge revenues from the sports arena tax as security for borrowing, excluding them from the debt limit calculation. The dollar amount equivalent to 14 percent of District revenues is determined under a specific section of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act. SEC. 203 states that no appropriation is needed for arena preconstruction activities, including borrowing, pledging of revenues, and payment of associated costs. SEC. 204 describes the arena preconstruction activities. The arena preconstruction activities include acquiring real property, site preparation, utility infrastructure provision, Metrorail connection financing, government employee relocation, and obtaining regulatory approvals. The financing of administrative and transaction costs for borrowing funds, issuance of bonds, and other obligations related to the construction of the sports arena, as well as financing other activities of the District of Columbia government associated with the development of the arena. This includes reimbursing costs incurred prior to the enactment of this Act, deemed reasonable by the designated authority. TITLE III--WAIVER OF CONGRESSIONAL REVIEW

SEC. 301. WAIVER OF CONGRESSIONAL REVIEW OF ARENA TAX PAYMENT AND USE AMENDMENT ACT OF 1995.

The Arena Tax Payment and Use Amendment Act of 1995 (D.C. Act 11-115) will be in effect upon the enactment of this Act.
